{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2503.24175v1", "title": "What is the Funniest Number? An investigation of numerical humor", "summary": "In a preliminary study of numerical humor, we propose the Perceived
Specificity Hypothesis (PSH). The PSH states that, for nonnegative integers <
100, the funniness of a number increases with its apparent precision. A survey
of 68 individuals supports the veracity of this hypothesis and indicates that
oddly specific numbers tend to be funniest. Our results motivate future study
in this novel subfield.", "main_category": "math.NT", "categories": "math.NT,math.HO", "published": "2025-03-31T14:52:12Z"}
